item.title: 2026 McKinney Writing Contest is open!
item.description: The 2026 McKinney Writing Contest is open from November 1, 2025 through March 9, 2026. Submit in any or all of the following categories: Fiction, Creative Nonfiction, or Drama; Poetry; Academic Essay; Language & Image; or our NEW category: Writing for Games. Undergraduate and graduate divisions. First prize $300; 2nd prize $175; and 3rd prize $75. Submit: https://hass.rpi.edu/mckinney. Submit in fall for December graduates. Questions? McKinney@rpi.edu

item.title: Claim your Bloomberg.com account courtesy of RPI Libraries
item.description: The RPI Libraries are pleased to announce campus access to Bloomberg.com, a premier resource for business and financial information and global insights. Sign in using your RPI credentials for unlimited access to Bloomberg.com, including live radio, podcasts, narrated articles, and live streaming of Bloomberg TV. Also available on the Bloomberg app!

item.title: CMDIS Annual Research Symposium Abstract Deadline Announcement
item.description: Date: Saturday, December 13, 2025 12:00 AM - Fri., January 9, 2026 11:55 PM - The Center for Materials, Devices and Integrated Systems (CMDIS) Annual Research Symposium will take place on Friday, February 6, 2026, at the Heffner Alumni House. Abstract submissions for talks, posters, and Art-in-Science are due Sunday, January 4, 2026, at 11:59 PM. item.title: An Important Notice to All Instructors Regarding LMS Spring 2026 Course Requests
item.description: All Rensselaer Learning Management System (Blackboard Learn SaaS) instructors, designers, and TAs who are planning on having an LMS course site for the Spring 2026 term should note that “Do submit” and “Do not submit” conditionals are still in place for submitting their course requests.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: HelioCampus Spring 2026 Syllabus Available - Complete by January 26, 2026
item.description: The HelioCampus syllabus module is now available for faculty to access for the spring. Based on the requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published in HelioCampus by January 26, 2026. HelioCampus will publish all syllabi automatically on February 2, 2026. Please review post to register for one of the two training sessions that will be offered in January 2026.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Apply Now to RPI’s Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program!
item.description: The Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program (CSTEP) is excited to announce that applications for the Spring semester are now open! CSTEP is an academic enrichment program designed to support New York State residents who are economically disadvantaged and pursuing careers in STEM or health-related fields. Don’t miss this chance to elevate your academic and professional journey-apply today by visiting here and reach out to InclusiveExcellence@rpi.edu with any questions!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Reviewing Course Evaluation Results Training Webinar in HelioCampus (Instructors and TAs)
item.description:
Fall 2025 Student Course Evaluation Results are now available. There are a couple upcoming trainings on how to view your data results and run various reports in HelioCampus. Be sure to sign up to learn more or for a refresher!
